graph.original_query: Create a comprehensive web scraping system that extracts product data from https://books.toscrape.com, processes it, and generates a detailed report

nodes.agent_prompt: Write a Python script using Beautiful Soup and Requests to scrape product data (title, price, availability, image URL, product URL) from the first page of https://books.toscrape.com. Store the data in a JSON format.

code_variants.CODE_1A:
import requests
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
import json

url = 'https://books.toscrape.com'
response = requests.get(url)
soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser')

products = []
for article in soup.find_all('article', class_='product_pod'):
    title = article.h3.a['title']
    product_url = url + '/' + article.h3.a['href']
    price = article.find('p', class_='price_color').text
    availability = article.find('p', class_='instock availability').text.strip()
    image_url = url + '/' + article.img['src']
    products.append({
        'title': title,
        'product_url': product_url,
        'price': price,
        'availability': availability,
        'image_url': image_url
    })

product_data_json = json.dumps(products, indent=4)

return {'product_data_page_1_T001': product_data_json}

code_variants.CODE_1A:
import requests
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
import json

url = 'https://books.toscrape.com/catalogue/page-3.html'
response = requests.get(url)

soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser')
products = soup.find_all('article', class_='product_pod')

product_list = []
for product in products:
    title = product.h3.a['title']
    product_url = 'https://books.toscrape.com/catalogue/' + product.h3.a['href']
    price = product.find('p', class_='price_color').text
    availability = product.find('p', class_='instock availability').text.strip()
    image_url = 'https://books.toscrape.com/' + product.img['src']
    
    product_data = {
        'title': title,
        'product_url': product_url,
        'price': price,
        'availability': availability,
        'image_url': image_url
    }
    product_list.append(product_data)

product_json = json.dumps(product_list, indent=4)

return {'product_data_page_3_T003': product_json}

nodes.agent_prompt: Write a Python script using Beautiful Soup and Requests to scrape product data (title, price, availability, image URL, product URL) from the fourth page of https://books.toscrape.com. Store the data in a JSON format.

code_variants.CODE_1A:
import requests
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
import json

url = 'https://books.toscrape.com/catalogue/page-4.html'
response = requests.get(url)
soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser')

products = []
for article in soup.find_all('article', class_='product_pod'):
    title = article.h3.a['title']
    product_url = 'https://books.toscrape.com/catalogue/' + article.h3.a['href']
    price = article.find('p', class_='price_color').text
    availability = article.find('p', class_='instock availability').text.strip()
    try:
        image_url = 'https://books.toscrape.com/' + article.find('img', class_='thumbnail')['src'].replace('../', '')
    except:
        image_url = None

    product = {
        'title': title,
        'product_url': product_url,
        'price': price,
        'availability': availability,
        'image_url': image_url
    }
    products.append(product)


product_data_json = json.dumps(products, indent=4)

return {'product_data_page_4_T004': product_data_json}

nodes.description: Merge data from all scraped pages.
nodes.agent_prompt: Write a Python script to merge the product data from `product_data_page_1_T001`, `product_data_page_2_T002`, `product_data_page_3_T003`, and `product_data_page_4_T004` into a single JSON file. Handle potential data inconsistencies or duplicates.

output.next_instruction: Execute the merging script and check for any errors. If errors are present, refine the code to handle edge cases.

code_variants.CODE_1A:
import json

data_sources = [
    product_data_page_1_T001,
    product_data_page_2_T002,
    product_data_page_3_T003,
    product_data_page_4_T004
]

merged_data = []

for data in data_sources:
    if isinstance(data, list):
        merged_data.extend(data)

# Remove duplicates based on a unique identifier (e.g., product ID)
unique_data = []
seen_ids = set()
for item in merged_data:
    if isinstance(item, dict) and 'id' in item and item['id'] not in seen_ids:
        unique_data.append(item)
        seen_ids.add(item['id'])


# Convert to JSON string
json_output = json.dumps(unique_data, indent=4)

with open('merged_product_data.json', 'w') as f:
    f.write(json_output)

return {"merged_product_data_T005": 'merged_product_data.json'}
